abstracts.cdata!:
The general outcome of the Punjab
            Irrigation and Drainage Project is deemed unsatisfactory
            with unlikely sustainability. The project was successful in
            implementing most of its physical targets, however,
            institutional strengthening components and the performance
            of the borrower in providing a supportive policy and funding
            environment has been disappointing. The key lessons learned
            centered around the needs of a project in several areas
            including: a) a strategy and broader conceptual framework;
            b) sustainable water pricing and operation and maintenance;
            c) participatory irrigation management and water user
            associations; d) institutional development; e) integration
            with agricultural development; f) coordination between
            governmental agencies; and g) multi-disciplinary bank and
            borrower staff inputs.
